pullRequest.title: Address all current `content: correction` issues
pullRequest.bodyText:
Summary of the changes / Why this improves CrateDB
all commits on this PR are for #10773
Checklist

 Added an entry in CHANGES.txt for user facing changes
 Updated documentation & sql_features table for user facing changes
 Touched code is covered by tests
 CLA is signed
 This does not contain breaking changes, or if it does:

It is released within a major release
It is recorded in CHANGES.txt
It was marked as deprecated in an earlier release if possible
You've thought about the consequences and other components are adapted
(E.g. AdminUI)

beforeCommit.message:
Improvement: Fix use product names in the release notes

Product names, such as PostgreSQ, should always be referred to in full and
using proper noun capitalization (or the brand appropriate typographical
stylization).

Additionally, this changeset fixes the use of `crate` as a literal.

afterCommit.message:
Improvement: Fix use product names in the release notes (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#155)

Product names, such as PostgreSQ, should always be referred to in full and
using proper noun capitalization (or the brand appropriate typographical
stylization).

Additionally, this changeset fixes the use of `crate` as a literal.

afterCommit.message:
Correction: Fix use product names in the release notes (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#155)

Product names, such as PostgreSQ, should always be referred to in full and
using proper noun capitalization (or the brand appropriate typographical
stylization).

Additionally, this changeset fixes the use of `crate` as a literal.

beforeCommit.message: fixup! Correction: Add note about the unavailability of KILL on CrateDB Cloud (fixes #10209)

afterCommit.message:
Correction: Add a note about the availability of the `KILL` statement (fixes #10209)

This change also fixes a minor RST formatting issue with another link in the
same document.

beforeCommit.message: Correction: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for links (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#316)

afterCommit.message:
Correction: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for links (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#316)

This change also zaps some trailing whitespace.

nodes.bodyText: This link does not work with https
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -308,11 +308,11 @@ optimized.*
    Complex queries are broken down into subqueries that are run on their shards
    before joining.
 
-.. _this article: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/33052/Visual-Representation-of-SQL-Joins
+.. _this article: https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/33052/Visual-Representation-of-SQL-Joins
 .. _table function: https://crate.io/docs/reference/en/latest/sql/table_functions.html
 .. _information_schema: https://crate.io/docs/reference/sql/information_schema.html
 .. _system tables: https://crate.io/docs/reference/sql/system.html
-.. _here: http://www.dcs.ed.ac.uk/home/tz/phd/thesis.pdf
+.. _here: https://www.dcs.ed.ac.uk/home/tz/phd/thesis.pdf

beforeCommit.message:
Correction: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for links (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#316)

This change also zaps some trailing whitespace.

afterCommit.message:
Correction: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for links (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#316)

This change also zaps some trailing whitespace.

commit.message: Correction: Clarify `single-node` admonition and copy to shared-nothing concepts document (fixes #10058)
Correction: Add note about doc only being available after the first table is created (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#206)
Correction: Add clarification and cross-reference for object literals syntax (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#201)
Correction: Fix default authentication config documentation intro (fixes #10119)

Correction: Fix use product names in the release notes (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#155)

Product names, such as PostgreSQ, should always be referred to in full and
using proper noun capitalization (or the brand appropriate typographical
stylization).

Additionally, this changeset fixes the use of `crate` as a literal.

Correction: Add a note about the availability of the `KILL` statement (fixes #10209)

This change also fixes a minor RST formatting issue with another link in the
same document.

Correction: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for links (fixes crate/tech-writing-domain#316)

This change also zaps some trailing whitespace.

beforeCommit.message: Merge branch 'nomi/content-corrections' of https://github.com/crate/crate into nomi/content-corrections

afterCommit.message:

This change also zaps some trailing whitespace.
